simpleUIApp

Class MouseListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • simpleUIApp.MouseListener
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MouseHandler<simpleUIApp.Item>

    public class MouseListener
extends java.lang.Object
implements MouseHandler<simpleUIApp.Item>
    the MouseListener handles the mouse's actions
    Author:
    Laura

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MouseListener() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void mouseClicked(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0, KeyPress arg1)
      mouseClicked is called when a mouse click has been done.
      void mouseDrag(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0, KeyPress arg1)
      creating a dragList containing the items from arg0
      void mouseDragging(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0, KeyPress arg1)
      on mouse dragg : if CTRL is pressed : can add several planets from the player in the dragList
      void mouseDrop(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0, KeyPress arg1)
      on MouseDrop : if pressing ALTGR, changing the target of the planet's current squadron (spaceships) by the planet on drop else just targetting the planet on drop
      void mouseOver(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0, KeyPress arg1)
      mouseOver is called with the elements available at the current position.
      void mouseWheelMoved(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0, KeyPress arg1, int arg2)
      mouseWheel moved UP : increment the percent of ships sent by 5% mouseWheel moved DOWN : decrement the percent of ships sent by 5%

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

      • mouseClicked

        public void mouseClicked(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0,
                         KeyPress arg1)
        Description copied from interface: MouseHandler
        mouseClicked is called when a mouse click has been done.
        Specified by:
        mouseClicked in interface MouseHandler<simpleUIApp.Item>
        Parameters:
        arg0 - is the list of items available at the click position
        arg1 - is the key pressed during the drag and drop from "CTRL", "SHIFT", "ALT GR" and "UNKOWN" (default)

        arg1 - is the key pressed during the drag and drop from "CTRL", "SHIFT", "ALT GR" and "UNKOWN" (default)

      • mouseDrop

        public void mouseDrop(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0,
                      KeyPress arg1)
        on MouseDrop : if pressing ALTGR, changing the target of the planet's current squadron (spaceships) by the planet on drop else just targetting the planet on drop
        Specified by:
        mouseDrop in interface MouseHandler<simpleUIApp.Item>
        Parameters:
        arg0 - is the list of items available at the drop position
        arg1 - is the key pressed during the drag and drop from "CTRL", "SHIFT", "ALT GR" and "UNKOWN" (default)

      • mouseOver

        public void mouseOver(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0,
                      KeyPress arg1)
        Description copied from interface: MouseHandler
        mouseOver is called with the elements available at the current position.
        Specified by:
        mouseOver in interface MouseHandler<simpleUIApp.Item>
        Parameters:
        arg0 - is the list of items available at the current position
        arg1 - is the key currently pressed from "CTRL", "SHIFT", "ALT GR" and "UNKOWN" (default)

      • mouseWheelMoved

        public void mouseWheelMoved(java.util.List<simpleUIApp.Item> arg0,
                            KeyPress arg1,
                            int arg2)
        mouseWheel moved UP : increment the percent of ships sent by 5% mouseWheel moved DOWN : decrement the percent of ships sent by 5%
        Specified by:
        mouseWheelMoved in interface MouseHandler<simpleUIApp.Item>
        Parameters:
        arg0 - is the list of items available at the click position
        arg1 - is the key pressed during the drag and drop from "CTRL", "SHIFT", "ALT GR" and "UNKOWN" (default)
        arg2 - either -1 or 1 depending on the direction of the rotation of the mouse wheel
